techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' - Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Corporations
techs.quote: 'If you can't feed a team with two pizzas, it's too large.' - Jeff Bezos

techs.name: Electronics
techs.quote: 'There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.' - Trip Hawkins

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: 'In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.' - Cicero

techs.name: Atomic Theory
techs.quote: 'The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: 'Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.' - Jonathan Swift

techs.name: Infraestructure
techs.quote: 'As an architect, you design for the present, with an awareness of the past, for a future which is essentially unknown.' - Norman Foster

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.' - Ludwig von Mises

techs.name: Ecology
techs.quote: 'Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.' - Rachel Carson

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: 'I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.' - J. Robert Oppenheimer

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.' - Astronautics Magazine, 1937

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'Computers are like Old Testament gods: lots of rules and no mercy.' - Joseph Campbell

techs.name: Telecommunications
techs.quote: 'The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.' - J.B. Priestly

techs.name: Urbanization
techs.quote: 'Seasons change. So do cities. People come into your life and people go, but it's comforting to know: the ones you love are always in your heart. And if you're very lucky, a plane ride away.' - Michael Patrick

techs.name: Advanced Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power, we have guided missiles and misguided men.' â€“ Martin Luther King Jr.

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: 'Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.' - Lyndon B. Johnson

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: The Internet
techs.quote: 'The Internet is the first thing that humanity has built that humanity doesn't understand.' - Eric Schmidt

techs.name: Globalization
techs.quote: 'The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.' - Marshall McLuhan

techs.name: Genetics
techs.quote: 'I'm fascinated by the idea that genetics is digital. A gene is a long sequence of coded letters, like computer information. Modern biology is becoming very much a branch of information technology.' - Richard Dawkins

techs.name: Artificial Intelligence
techs.quote: 'With artificial intelligence, we are summoning the demon. You know all those stories where there's the guy with the pentagram and the holy water, and he's like, yeah, he's sure he can control the demon? Doesn't work out.' - Elon Musk

techs.name: Mobile Tactics
techs.quote: 'All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Stealth
techs.quote: 'Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness, be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Enhancing
techs.quote: 'Zombies let us explore notions of the apocalypse - no water, food, medical care, the government imploding - while letting us sleep at night.' - Max Brooks

techs.name: Nanotechnology
techs.quote: 'Nanotechnology will let us build computers that are incredibly powerful. We'll have more power in the volume of a sugar cube than exists in the entire world today.' - Ralph Merkle

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'You can't blame gravity for falling in love.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Automation
techs.quote: 'I visualize a time when we will be to robots what dogs are to humans, and I'm rooting for the machines.' - Claude Shannon

techs.name: Metagenetics
techs.quote: 'Neuroscience is a baby science, a mere century old, and our scientific understanding of the brain is nowhere near where we'd like it to be. We know more about the moons of Jupiter than what is inside of our skulls.' - Matt Haig

techs.name: Terraforming
techs.quote: 'How inappropriate to call this planet Earth when it is quite clearly Ocean.' - Arthur C. Clarke

techs.name: Clean Energy
uniques: +1 Power to Buildings that provide it
techs.quote: 'For an impenetrable shield, stand inside yourself.' - Henry David

techs.name: Spaceflight
techs.quote: 'That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.' - Neil Armstrong

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
techs.quote: 'The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has readily made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: World Alliance
techs.quote: 'Neuroscience is a baby science, a mere century old, and our scientific understanding of the brain is nowhere near where we'd like it to be. We know more about the moons of Jupiter than what is inside of our skulls.' - Matt Haig

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

techs.name: Particle Physics
techs.quote: 'Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.' - Isaac Newton
